data:
1
00:01:47,519 --> 00:01:49,279
Bingo!

2
00:02:02,999 --> 00:02:04,799
Fucking hell.

3
00:02:06,959 --> 00:02:08,840
Fucking hell.

4
00:02:56,919 --> 00:02:59,479
- Oh, God...
- Keep your shit together.

5
00:02:59,560 --> 00:03:02,519
If you wanna get 'em out of here.

6
00:03:03,319 --> 00:03:05,880
- I can pop these, no problem.
- So get to it!

7
00:03:19,519 --> 00:03:21,920
Security, we have a break-in. Get the...

8
00:03:30,040 --> 00:03:32,760
I know who you are.
I know what you think...

9
00:03:32,839 --> 00:03:36,519
If you don't wanna get hurt,
keep your mouth shut and don't move.

10
00:03:36,600 --> 00:03:41,639
The chimps are infected. They're highly
contagious. They've been given an inhibitor.

11
00:03:41,720 --> 00:03:45,039
- Infected with what?
- To cure, you must first understand.

12
00:03:45,120 --> 00:03:47,959
Infected with what?

13
00:03:49,839 --> 00:03:51,639
Rage.

14
00:03:53,279 --> 00:03:56,319
- What is he talking about?
- Get the cages open.

15
00:03:56,399 --> 00:03:57,679
No! No! No!

16
00:03:58,359 --> 00:04:02,479
Listen, you sick bastard,
we're taking your torture victims with us.

17
00:04:02,560 --> 00:04:04,080
We'll get you out of here.

18
00:04:04,160 --> 00:04:08,639
The animals are contagious. The infection
is in their blood and saliva. One bite...

19
00:04:08,720 --> 00:04:11,119
Stop... Stop! You've no idea!

20
00:04:17,399 --> 00:04:20,120
Get it off! Help me!

21
00:04:25,280 --> 00:04:27,319
Get it off! Get it off!

22
00:04:30,800 --> 00:04:33,879
- What's the matter with her?
- You have to kill her!

23
00:04:35,880 --> 00:04:38,040
Oh, my God!

24
00:04:42,200 --> 00:04:45,279
- What's the matter with her?
- We have to kill her now!

25
00:04:47,680 --> 00:04:49,200
Oh, God...

26
00:06:33,720 --> 00:06:35,159
Hello?

27
00:07:12,039 --> 00:07:13,480
Hello?

28
00:07:30,880 --> 00:07:32,800
Hello!

29
00:09:10,559 --> 00:09:11,840
Hello?

30
00:09:37,080 --> 00:09:38,519
Hello!

31
00:14:18,879 --> 00:14:20,880
Hello?

32
00:14:28,560 --> 00:14:30,559
Hello?

33
00:14:44,320 --> 00:14:46,319
Father?

34
00:14:52,479 --> 00:14:54,480
Father, are you OK?

35
00:15:01,519 --> 00:15:04,080
Oh, shouldn't have done that.

36
00:15:04,480 --> 00:15:06,639
Shouldn't have done that.

37
00:15:07,039 --> 00:15:08,840
Shit!

38
00:15:34,520 --> 00:15:36,560
Over here!

39
00:15:39,320 --> 00:15:41,559
- Over here!
- Come on!

40
00:15:53,519 --> 00:15:55,879
Go, go, go!

41
00:16:00,919 --> 00:16:01,960
Keep going!

42
00:16:02,039 --> 00:16:04,799
- What the fuck is going on?
- Just shut up!

43
00:16:12,599 --> 00:16:15,079
- Covered everything.
- Who are those people?

44
00:16:41,279 --> 00:16:42,479
Let's go! Let's go!

45
00:16:42,560 --> 00:16:44,720
- What the fuck is going on?
- Just move!

46
00:16:53,159 --> 00:16:55,079
Come on!

47
00:17:13,479 --> 00:17:18,039
Man walks into a bar with a giraffe.
They each get pissed.

48
00:17:18,119 --> 00:17:20,039
The giraffe falls over.

49
00:17:20,120 --> 00:17:25,119
The man goes to leave and the barman says
"Oi! You can't leave that lying there."

50
00:17:25,200 --> 00:17:29,080
He says "No, it's not a lion. It's a giraffe".

51
00:17:36,399 --> 00:17:39,159
He's completely humourless.

52
00:17:39,239 --> 00:17:42,039
You two should get on like a house on fire.

53
00:17:43,480 --> 00:17:45,480
So who are you?

54
00:17:46,640 --> 00:17:48,479
You're from the hospital.

55
00:17:48,560 --> 00:17:51,919
- Are you a doctor?
- He's not a doctor. He's a patient.

56
00:17:51,999 --> 00:17:54,239
I'm a bicycle courier.

57
00:17:56,320 --> 00:18:02,479
I was riding a package from Farringdon to
Shaftesbury Avenue and a car cut across me.

58
00:18:02,559 --> 00:18:06,159
Then I wake up today in hospital.
I wake up and I'm...

59
00:18:06,240 --> 00:18:08,079
I'm hallucinating or I'm...

60
00:18:09,680 --> 00:18:12,039
What's your name?

61
00:18:12,120 --> 00:18:14,119
Jim.

62
00:18:14,760 --> 00:18:17,320
I'm Mark. This is Selena.

63
00:18:21,560 --> 00:18:23,159
OK, Jim.

64
00:18:28,160 --> 00:18:30,599
I've got some bad news.

65
00:18:30,679 --> 00:18:36,680
It started as rioting, and right from
the beginning you knew this was different.

66
00:18:36,759 --> 00:18:40,760
Because it was happening
in small villages, market towns.

67
00:18:41,600 --> 00:18:44,240
And then it wasn't on the TV any more.

68
00:18:44,319 --> 00:18:48,839
It was in the street outside.
It was coming through your windows.

69
00:18:48,919 --> 00:18:50,680
It was a virus.

70
00:18:50,759 --> 00:18:52,480
An infection.

71
00:18:52,560 --> 00:18:55,279
You didn't need a doctor to tell you that.

72
00:18:55,360 --> 00:18:57,719
It was the blood.

73
00:18:57,800 --> 00:19:00,199
There was something in the blood.

74
00:19:01,599 --> 00:19:06,359
By the time they tried to evacuate
the cities, it was already too late.

75
00:19:06,440 --> 00:19:09,239
The infection was everywhere.

76
00:19:09,320 --> 00:19:11,719
The army blockades were overrun.

77
00:19:13,199 --> 00:19:15,800
And that's when the exodus started.

78
00:19:17,120 --> 00:19:19,760
The day before broadcasting stopped,

79
00:19:19,839 --> 00:19:23,359
there were reports of Infection
in Paris and New York.

80
00:19:25,640 --> 00:19:28,439
We didn't hear anything more after that.

81
00:19:31,280 --> 00:19:34,120
- What's the government doing?
- There's no government.

82
00:19:34,199 --> 00:19:36,559
Of course there's a government!

83
00:19:36,640 --> 00:19:40,560
There's always a government.
They're in a bunker or a plane...

84
00:19:40,639 --> 00:19:44,759
No, there's no government,
no police, no army.

85
00:19:46,159 --> 00:19:49,120
No TV, no radio, no electricity.

86
00:19:49,719 --> 00:19:53,719
You're the first uninfected person
we've seen in six days.

87
00:19:54,519 --> 00:19:56,520
Where's your family?

88
00:19:57,399 --> 00:19:59,360
They're dead. Like Selena's.

89
00:19:59,439 --> 00:20:01,479
Yours will be dead too.

90
00:20:11,359 --> 00:20:15,199
Look, I have to find them.
They live in Deptford. I can walk it. OK?

91
00:20:15,280 --> 00:20:17,760
You'll go and come back, yeah?

92
00:20:19,639 --> 00:20:21,799
- You won't.
- Yes!

93
00:20:21,880 --> 00:20:24,760
No one ever comes back.

94
00:20:29,079 --> 00:20:31,080
So lesson one.

95
00:20:31,920 --> 00:20:36,160
You never go anywhere alone
unless you've got no choice.

96
00:20:36,239 --> 00:20:38,480
Lesson two.

97
00:20:38,559 --> 00:20:42,480
Only travel during daylight.
Unless you've got no choice.

98
00:20:44,439 --> 00:20:46,400
We'll take you tomorrow.

99
00:20:46,479 --> 00:20:49,919
We'll all go and find
your dead parents together, OK?

100
00:20:50,919 --> 00:20:52,320
Eat.

101
00:21:04,000 --> 00:21:07,039
If you want her to slow down,
you'll have to say.

102
00:21:32,839 --> 00:21:34,440
- If there's anyone...
- I understand.

103
00:21:34,519 --> 00:21:36,520
- Anyone...
- I understand!

104
00:21:38,560 --> 00:21:40,040
OK.

105
00:22:20,120 --> 00:22:21,399
Jim...

106
00:22:22,200 --> 00:22:23,479
Wait!

107
00:23:44,679 --> 00:23:48,479
They died peacefully.
You should be grateful.

108
00:23:48,560 --> 00:23:50,880
I'm not grateful.

109
00:23:52,079 --> 00:23:53,999
My...

110
00:23:54,679 --> 00:23:59,000
parents and my sister,
we went to Paddington Station,

111
00:24:01,519 --> 00:24:06,639
hoping maybe we could get on a plane,
maybe we could buy our way onto a plane.

112
00:24:07,240 --> 00:24:09,519
I remember my dad had all this cash,

113
00:24:09,600 --> 00:24:12,799
even though cash was completely useless.

114
00:24:14,279 --> 00:24:17,280
About 20,000 other people had the same idea.

115
00:24:19,679 --> 00:24:21,800
Crowd was surging.

116
00:24:22,600 --> 00:24:24,839
I lost my grip on my sister's hand.

117
00:24:26,919 --> 00:24:29,160
I remember the ground was soft.

118
00:24:31,039 --> 00:24:35,240
I looked down
and I was standing on all these people.

119
00:24:35,320 --> 00:24:39,119
Like a carpet. People who had fallen and...

120
00:24:39,200 --> 00:24:42,999
Somewhere in the crowd
there were Infected. It spread fast.

121
00:24:43,079 --> 00:24:46,279
No one could run.
All you could do was climb.

122
00:24:47,840 --> 00:24:50,799
Climb over more people.
So I did that. I climbed.

123
00:24:50,880 --> 00:24:53,160
And I got up on top of this kiosk.

124
00:24:55,360 --> 00:25:00,119
Looking down, you couldn't tell
which faces were infected and which weren't.

125
00:25:00,200 --> 00:25:03,919
Then I saw my dad.
Not my mum or my sister.

126
00:25:04,000 --> 00:25:05,879
My dad.

127
00:25:08,079 --> 00:25:10,080
His face...

128
00:25:13,600 --> 00:25:17,360
Selena's right.
You should be grateful.

129
00:25:17,440 --> 00:25:22,400
We don't have time to get back to the shop
before dark. We should stay here tonight.

130
00:25:24,959 --> 00:25:27,679
My room's up at the top.
You two can have that.

131
00:25:27,760 --> 00:25:30,959
No, we'll all sleep in the same room. It's safer.

132
00:26:47,960 --> 00:26:49,959
Jim.

133
00:26:58,280 --> 00:27:00,279
- You're back.
- Yeah.

134
00:27:06,400 --> 00:27:08,400
- How was it?
- Fine.

135
00:27:09,439 --> 00:27:11,639
Give me a drink of that, will ya?

136
00:27:11,720 --> 00:27:13,719
- It's empty.
- Ha!

137
00:27:15,919 --> 00:27:18,160
Here.

138
00:27:20,159 --> 00:27:22,160
I'll start working on them, then.

139
00:27:28,519 --> 00:27:30,439
Mark! Mark!

140
00:27:31,200 --> 00:27:33,240
Selena! Help!

141
00:27:47,000 --> 00:27:49,000
It's clear.

142
00:27:54,240 --> 00:27:57,079
- That's Mr Bridges.
- Were you bitten?

143
00:27:57,159 --> 00:27:59,279
And his daughter. From four doors down.

144
00:27:59,359 --> 00:28:02,320
- Were you bitten?
- No.

145
00:28:02,399 --> 00:28:05,200
Did any of the blood get in your mouth?

146
00:28:06,079 --> 00:28:07,999
No.

147
00:28:11,000 --> 00:28:12,679
Mark?

148
00:28:14,999 --> 00:28:16,639
Wait...

149
00:28:37,600 --> 00:28:39,719
Get that cleaned off.

150
00:28:41,519 --> 00:28:43,519
Do you have any clothes here?

151
00:28:44,600 --> 00:28:46,399
Um... I... Yes.

152
00:28:46,480 --> 00:28:49,999
Then get them and get dressed.
We have to leave now.

153
00:28:50,080 --> 00:28:53,600
More Infected will be coming.
They always do.

154
00:29:21,200 --> 00:29:24,080
How did you know?
How did you know he was infected?

155
00:29:24,159 --> 00:29:27,920
- The blood.
- There was blood on me. It was on you.

156
00:29:27,999 --> 00:29:33,160
I didn't know he was infected.
He knew. I could see it in his face.

157
00:29:33,240 --> 00:29:37,479
If someone gets infected,
you've about 20 seconds to kill them.

158
00:29:37,559 --> 00:29:42,480
It might be your brother, your sister
or your oldest friend. It makes no difference.

159
00:29:42,559 --> 00:29:47,759
Just so you know where you stand,
if it happens to you, I'll do it in a heartbeat.

160
00:29:47,840 --> 00:29:51,879
He was full of plans.
Have you got any plans, Jim?

161
00:29:51,960 --> 00:29:56,239
Do you want us to find a cure and
save the world or just fall in love and fuck?

162
00:29:56,320 --> 00:29:58,719
Plans are pointless.

163
00:29:58,800 --> 00:30:01,280
Staying alive's as good as it gets.

164
00:30:03,040 --> 00:30:04,400
Hey, hey, hey, hey.

165
00:30:04,479 --> 00:30:06,480
What's that?

166
00:30:12,319 --> 00:30:14,319
Let's go.

167
00:30:57,600 --> 00:31:00,599
What is it about tower blocks
and shopping trolleys?

168
00:31:00,679 --> 00:31:03,640
Stop talking. It's a long way up.

169
00:31:12,960 --> 00:31:15,200
Do you need a break?

170
00:31:16,359 --> 00:31:18,279
- You?
- No.

171
00:31:20,840 --> 00:31:22,840
Now I do need a break.

172
00:31:32,880 --> 00:31:34,640
What's up?

173
00:31:34,719 --> 00:31:36,639
Nothin'.

174
00:31:38,920 --> 00:31:40,199
I got a headache.

175
00:31:40,280 --> 00:31:41,719
- Bad?
- Pretty bad.

176
00:31:41,800 --> 00:31:46,880
- Why didn't you say something before?
- I didn't think you'd give a shit.

177
00:31:48,039 --> 00:31:52,119
You've got no fat on you
and all you've had to eat is sugar.

178
00:31:52,200 --> 00:31:54,240
So you're crashing.

179
00:31:54,319 --> 00:31:56,480
There isn't a lot we can do about that

180
00:31:56,559 --> 00:32:01,440
except pump you full of painkillers
and give you more sugar. As for sugar,

181
00:32:01,520 --> 00:32:03,720
Pepsi or Lilt?

182
00:32:04,919 --> 00:32:06,839
Do you have any Tango?

183
00:32:06,920 --> 00:32:09,839
Actually,
I did have a can of Tango somewhere.

184
00:32:11,000 --> 00:32:13,159
Quiet! That's an Infected.

185
00:32:23,080 --> 00:32:24,840
Oh no, they're in. Move!

186
00:32:27,799 --> 00:32:30,240
Wait up, Selena!

187
00:32:31,119 --> 00:32:33,039
Wait for me, please!

188
00:32:33,120 --> 00:32:35,160
Please, Selena! Please!

189
00:32:35,239 --> 00:32:37,480
- Wait for me!
- Come on!

190
00:32:37,559 --> 00:32:39,479
- Run!
- Wait!

191
00:32:40,080 --> 00:32:42,680
Please! For fuck's sake!

192
00:32:43,240 --> 00:32:45,399
- Selena!
-

193
00:32:47,039 --> 00:32:50,279
Down the corridor. Flat 157. Move!

194
00:32:50,360 --> 00:32:52,359
Thank you. Thank you.

195
00:33:04,319 --> 00:33:06,280
Open the door!

196
00:33:11,640 --> 00:33:13,160
Open the door!

197
00:33:17,680 --> 00:33:20,079
- Open up!
- Where's Dad?

198
00:33:20,160 --> 00:33:21,559
What?

199
00:33:24,039 --> 00:33:26,919
- Open the fucking door!
- Where's Dad?

200
00:33:27,000 --> 00:33:29,200
Let them in, Hannah. Let them inside.

201
00:33:36,799 --> 00:33:38,999
Go in. Go in!

202
00:33:56,279 --> 00:33:58,639
So, I'm Frank, anyway.

203
00:33:58,719 --> 00:34:00,440
Jim.

204
00:34:01,239 --> 00:34:04,200
- Selena.
- Selena. Good to meet you.

205
00:34:04,280 --> 00:34:06,480
This is my daughter Hannah.

206
00:34:06,559 --> 00:34:08,720
Come on, sweetheart. Say hello.

207
00:34:10,080 --> 00:34:12,079
Come on.

208
00:34:12,800 --> 00:34:14,679
So...

209
00:34:14,760 --> 00:34:16,599
This is great. Just great.

210
00:34:18,840 --> 00:34:21,040
Calls for a celebration, I'd say.

211
00:34:21,119 --> 00:34:24,040
Why don't you all sit down and...

212
00:34:24,119 --> 00:34:26,960
Hannah, what have we got to offer?

213
00:34:27,040 --> 00:34:29,440
We've got Mum's creme de menthe.

214
00:34:29,520 --> 00:34:32,120
Great. Creme de menthe.

215
00:34:32,199 --> 00:34:34,799
Oh, yeah. Look, sit, please.

216
00:34:34,880 --> 00:34:37,240
Get comfortable.

217
00:34:39,960 --> 00:34:42,840
- Where are the bloody glasses?
- Middle cupboard.

218
00:34:42,919 --> 00:34:45,679
Nah, the good ones. It's a celebration.

219
00:34:45,760 --> 00:34:48,159
Top cupboard.

220
00:34:48,239 --> 00:34:50,839
So this is your place?

221
00:34:52,040 --> 00:34:53,719
It's nice.

222
00:35:06,359 --> 00:35:07,439
There.

223
00:35:07,520 --> 00:35:10,479
I know it isn't much but, well, cheers.

224
00:35:10,560 --> 00:35:12,239
Cheers.

225
00:35:32,880 --> 00:35:34,879
You OK in there, Jim?

226
00:35:35,800 --> 00:35:38,039
Yeah.

227
00:35:38,120 --> 00:35:43,480
Sorry we couldn't spare the water.
Same with the toilet. The flush doesn't work.

228
00:35:45,079 --> 00:35:47,239
You'll have to use the bucket.

229
00:35:53,520 --> 00:35:56,039
Have to empty it each morning.

230
00:35:56,120 --> 00:35:59,640
Just chuck it over the balcony.
No mod cons here.

231
00:35:59,719 --> 00:36:01,359
It's fine.

232
00:36:01,440 --> 00:36:04,440
Listen, it's late. We're gonna turn in.

233
00:36:06,039 --> 00:36:08,320
We have a spare room.

234
00:36:09,319 --> 00:36:10,559
In there.

235
00:36:10,640 --> 00:36:12,520
Are you and Selena...?

236
00:36:13,719 --> 00:36:15,479
No. No, no, no.

237
00:36:15,560 --> 00:36:17,159
Um...

238
00:36:17,240 --> 00:36:19,520
I'll take the living room. It's fine.

239
00:36:19,599 --> 00:36:21,399
Right.

240
00:36:22,239 --> 00:36:24,240
No, I mean, yeah.

241
00:36:25,239 --> 00:36:27,159
So, um...

242
00:36:28,160 --> 00:36:31,040
- Goodnight, then.
- Yeah. Goodnight, Frank.

243
00:36:45,080 --> 00:36:46,560
Very spruce.

244
00:36:47,839 --> 00:36:50,560
- Very shredded.
- Yeah.

245
00:36:54,719 --> 00:36:58,279
- So what do you make of them?
- Well, they're desperate.

246
00:36:59,359 --> 00:37:02,080
Probably need us more than we need them.

247
00:37:03,479 --> 00:37:05,640
I think they're good people.

248
00:37:08,360 --> 00:37:11,199
- Good people?
- Yeah.

249
00:37:12,920 --> 00:37:17,400
You should be more concerned about
whether they're gonna slow you down.

250
00:37:17,479 --> 00:37:21,079
- Because if they slowed you down...
- I'd leave them behind.

251
00:37:21,160 --> 00:37:22,999
- In a heartbeat.
- Yeah.

252
00:37:23,679 --> 00:37:25,280
I wouldn't.

253
00:37:25,360 --> 00:37:28,759
Then you're gonna wind up
getting yourself killed.

254
00:37:36,760 --> 00:37:39,159
I'm gonna get some sleep.

255
00:37:41,560 --> 00:37:43,360
Selena...

256
00:37:44,160 --> 00:37:47,279
You think I don't get it, but I do get it.

257
00:37:49,080 --> 00:37:52,920
And I know I'd be dead already
if I hadn't met you.

258
00:37:53,400 --> 00:37:54,919
Sure.

259
00:37:55,000 --> 00:37:56,520
No, look...

260
00:37:58,799 --> 00:38:00,800
I mean, thank you.

261
00:38:03,839 --> 00:38:05,919
And I mean, sure.

262
00:38:06,000 --> 00:38:08,679
Goodnight, Jim.

263
00:38:08,760 --> 00:38:10,760
Goodnight.

264
00:38:23,800 --> 00:38:25,799
We lost water pressure three weeks ago.

265
00:38:25,880 --> 00:38:29,840
I thought we'd be OK with the water
from the other flats. Cisterns and tanks.

266
00:38:29,919 --> 00:38:33,000
But it vanishes so quick
you wouldn't believe.

267
00:38:36,160 --> 00:38:37,800
You drink it,

268
00:38:37,879 --> 00:38:39,600
it evaporates,

269
00:38:39,679 --> 00:38:41,680
turns stagnant.

270
00:38:43,960 --> 00:38:45,959
They're all empty.

271
00:38:46,799 --> 00:38:48,719
Hasn't rained in ten days.

272
00:38:48,800 --> 00:38:52,880
You can set up a plastic sheet
to catch dew and condensation.

273
00:38:52,959 --> 00:38:56,559
Saw it on TV once, but I can't make it work.

274
00:38:57,840 --> 00:38:59,839
You'd never think it.

275
00:39:00,720 --> 00:39:03,560
Needing rain so badly.

276
00:39:05,159 --> 00:39:07,479
Not in fucking England!

277
00:39:11,960 --> 00:39:14,960
Jim, we're not going to be able to stay here.

278
00:39:23,519 --> 00:39:27,119
- There's been no broadcasts for weeks.
- Just listen.

279
00:39:27,200 --> 00:39:31,600
Salvation is here.
The answer to Infection is here.

280
00:39:31,680 --> 00:39:34,560
if you can hear this, you're not alone.

281
00:39:34,639 --> 00:39:38,960
There are others like you.
There are other survivors.

282
00:39:39,039 --> 00:39:41,160
We are soldiers and we are armed.

283
00:39:41,239 --> 00:39:44,399
Oh, my God. Soldiers.

284
00:39:44,480 --> 00:39:48,880
- Quiet. There's more.
- Our location is the 42nd blockade, M602,

285
00:39:48,960 --> 00:39:52,239
27 miles northeast of Manchester.

286
00:39:52,320 --> 00:39:56,079
- You must find us. Salvation is...
- Now it just repeats.

287
00:39:56,160 --> 00:39:58,440
- It's a recording?
- Yeah, it's a recording.

288
00:39:58,519 --> 00:40:01,320
But this is where it's telling us to go.

289
00:40:01,399 --> 00:40:03,479
Just there.

290
00:40:04,920 --> 00:40:09,519
The way things are, we might need
two or three days to get up there.

291
00:40:09,600 --> 00:40:11,240
"We"?

292
00:40:15,160 --> 00:40:20,999
Sound carries in this flat. Me and Hannah
do need you more than you need us.

293
00:40:21,080 --> 00:40:24,120
- Look, I didn't...
- No, it's OK. It's the truth.

294
00:40:24,199 --> 00:40:26,600
I can't leave the block if it's the two of us.

295
00:40:26,680 --> 00:40:30,479
Something might happen to me.
Hannah'd be alone. I couldn't risk it.

296
00:40:30,560 --> 00:40:32,200
But with other people...

297
00:40:32,279 --> 00:40:36,399
If it's a recording,
the soldiers who made it could be dead.

298
00:40:36,480 --> 00:40:39,839
- It's possible.
- That stuff about the answer to Infection...

299
00:40:39,919 --> 00:40:44,039
There is no answer!
It's already done all the damage it can!

300
00:40:44,120 --> 00:40:46,839
- Maybe they have a cure.
- Maybe they've got nothing.

301
00:40:46,919 --> 00:40:50,840
- The only way to find out is to reach them.
- We could die trying, Frank!

302
00:40:52,839 --> 00:40:55,039
Or die here.

303
00:40:55,120 --> 00:41:00,600
And anyway, it isn't true what Dad said.
You need us just the same as we need you.

304
00:41:02,039 --> 00:41:03,839
We need each other.

305
00:41:03,920 --> 00:41:08,999
And we'll never be safe in the cities.
The soldiers could keep us safe.

306
00:41:09,680 --> 00:41:11,680
So we have to try and get there.

307
00:41:12,759 --> 00:41:14,280
Get there how?

308
00:41:25,239 --> 00:41:28,840
Just so you know,
I don't take cheques or credit cards.

309
00:41:56,239 --> 00:41:59,119
- What do you think?
- It's the most direct route.

310
00:41:59,199 --> 00:42:04,240
Then we should take the indirect route.
The one in daylight and not underground.

311
00:42:04,319 --> 00:42:06,560
Let's just get it done.

312
00:42:18,959 --> 00:42:21,039
No, no.

313
00:42:21,120 --> 00:42:23,519
No. See, this is a really shit idea.

314
00:42:24,359 --> 00:42:27,599
You know why?
Because it's obviously a shit idea.

315
00:42:27,680 --> 00:42:31,879
So we're gonna drive into the tunnel
full of fucking smashed cars...

316
00:42:31,960 --> 00:42:34,759
It's really fucking obviously a shit idea!

317
00:42:34,840 --> 00:42:37,000
Hold on!

318
00:42:45,800 --> 00:42:47,600
Dad!

319
00:43:06,240 --> 00:43:07,720
Fuck!

320
00:43:08,960 --> 00:43:11,280
The world's worst place to get a flat.

321
00:43:11,359 --> 00:43:14,559
Agreed. I think we'd better do this quick.

322
00:43:16,960 --> 00:43:19,039
I've got the wheel. You're on the jack.

323
00:43:33,039 --> 00:43:36,440
Do you hear that?
Hey, hey, do you hear that?

324
00:43:36,520 --> 00:43:38,519
Hear what?

325
00:43:39,160 --> 00:43:41,360
Right, I've done it.

326
00:43:42,880 --> 00:43:44,279
Dad?

327
00:43:47,999 --> 00:43:50,960
- Jesus Christ!
-

328
00:43:51,039 --> 00:43:52,519
Fucking rats!

329
00:44:02,640 --> 00:44:05,119
They're running from the Infected.

330
00:44:05,200 --> 00:44:07,039
Move it!

331
00:44:07,120 --> 00:44:11,240
Forget the jack, Hannah.
There's no time. Just lift, everyone.

332
00:44:11,319 --> 00:44:14,439
Grab hold! One, two, three, lift!

333
00:44:18,240 --> 00:44:20,119
Lift, lift!

334
00:44:20,639 --> 00:44:25,559
- Don't look at them! Don't look!
- I can see them! They're coming!

335
00:44:31,039 --> 00:44:33,519
Come on, Hannah!

336
00:44:33,600 --> 00:44:35,920
Almost.

337
00:44:35,999 --> 00:44:38,800
- Get the tyre on, Hannah!
- I'm trying.

338
00:44:43,399 --> 00:44:45,960
Three, two, one,

339
00:44:46,039 --> 00:44:47,679
drop it!

340
00:44:51,639 --> 00:44:53,999
- Get in the car!
- Come on!

341
00:44:55,999 --> 00:44:58,280
- Frank, drive!
- Move it, Frank!

342
00:45:01,079 --> 00:45:03,080
Whoo!

343
00:45:07,679 --> 00:45:09,680
Goodbye, you fuckers!

344
00:45:17,319 --> 00:45:19,519
Frank, stop the cab.

345
00:45:41,559 --> 00:45:43,759
Let's shop.

346
00:45:53,960 --> 00:45:55,399
You...

347
00:45:56,160 --> 00:45:57,599
You...

348
00:45:58,400 --> 00:45:59,440
You...

349
00:45:59,519 --> 00:46:01,999
Anybody seen any buns?

350
00:46:02,080 --> 00:46:04,759
Hmm. Irradiated.

351
00:46:07,359 --> 00:46:10,799
Don't take anything
that needs to be cooked, OK?

352
00:46:10,880 --> 00:46:12,640
I think you can eat that raw.

353
00:46:12,719 --> 00:46:14,519
Decaffeinated coffee...

354
00:46:14,599 --> 00:46:16,600
Put that back.

355
00:46:17,759 --> 00:46:19,920
Can't just take any crap.

356
00:46:19,999 --> 00:46:24,320
If I never see another chocolate bar again,
it'll be too soon.

357
00:46:24,720 --> 00:46:27,280
Not counting Terry's Chocolate Orange!

358
00:46:28,840 --> 00:46:32,319
Now, single malt,
16-year-old, dark, full flavour.

359
00:46:33,240 --> 00:46:35,120
Warm but not aggressive.

360
00:46:35,199 --> 00:46:38,560
-
- Peaty aftertaste.

361
00:46:40,080 --> 00:46:43,200
Takes out the fire but leaves in the warmth.

362
00:47:35,839 --> 00:47:38,800
Either we do this now or we're walking.

363
00:47:45,520 --> 00:47:47,520
Not you.

364
00:47:50,720 --> 00:47:52,920
- Stay close, Jim.
- What?

365
00:47:52,999 --> 00:47:54,999
You heard.

366
00:48:20,480 --> 00:48:22,479
Where are you going?

367
00:48:23,520 --> 00:48:25,840
We've got enough food, Jim.

368
00:48:25,919 --> 00:48:28,160
We don't have any cheeseburgers.

369
00:48:28,879 --> 00:48:31,440
Like going on holidays
with your aunt!

370
00:49:09,040 --> 00:49:11,399
Oh, Jesus.

371
00:49:36,160 --> 00:49:37,639
Hello?

372
00:49:50,880 --> 00:49:52,599
I hate you!

373
00:50:01,400 --> 00:50:03,399
Find anything?

374
00:50:05,560 --> 00:50:08,239
- Find anything, Jim?
- No! Let's get outta here.

375
00:50:08,319 --> 00:50:10,320
OK, we're done here.

376
00:50:12,439 --> 00:50:14,239
OK, Hannah.

377
00:50:21,320 --> 00:50:22,919
Easy. Brake!

378
00:50:22,999 --> 00:50:25,000
Brake, brake!

379
00:50:32,519 --> 00:50:34,519
Out.

380
00:51:17,280 --> 00:51:20,359
Mmmm! Oh my God!

381
00:51:21,079 --> 00:51:23,959
I can, like, taste the vitamin C.

382
00:51:24,759 --> 00:51:27,440
Mmmm, the raisins are so moist.

383
00:51:28,599 --> 00:51:30,600
What did you say?

384
00:51:30,679 --> 00:51:33,359
The raisins. They're so moist.

385
00:51:37,919 --> 00:51:39,920
Look over here.

386
00:51:50,760 --> 00:51:52,520
Like a family.

387
00:51:52,599 --> 00:51:54,960
Do you think they're infected?

388
00:51:55,359 --> 00:51:57,360
No.

389
00:52:00,679 --> 00:52:03,279
They're doing just fine.

390
00:52:08,799 --> 00:52:10,800
Come on. Let's eat!

391
00:52:24,880 --> 00:52:26,160
Know what I was thinking?

392
00:52:26,240 --> 00:52:29,800
That you'll never hear
another piece of original music again.

393
00:52:29,879 --> 00:52:33,879
You'll never read a book
that hasn't already been written,

394
00:52:34,880 --> 00:52:38,559
or see a film that hasn't already been shot.

395
00:52:42,880 --> 00:52:46,000
Um.... that's what you were thinking.

396
00:52:46,079 --> 00:52:47,879
No.

397
00:52:49,079 --> 00:52:51,279
I was thinking I was wrong.

398
00:52:52,480 --> 00:52:54,479
About what?

399
00:52:56,119 --> 00:52:58,120
All the death.

400
00:52:58,679 --> 00:53:00,680
All this shit.

401
00:53:02,240 --> 00:53:06,560
It doesn't really mean anything
to Frank and Hannah because...

402
00:53:07,879 --> 00:53:11,199
Well, she's got her dad
and he's got his daughter. So...

403
00:53:11,280 --> 00:53:13,320
Cheeky monkey!

404
00:53:13,760 --> 00:53:17,239
I was wrong when I said
staying alive is as good as it gets.

405
00:53:20,720 --> 00:53:23,119
See, that's what I was thinking.

406
00:53:23,600 --> 00:53:25,199
Was it?

407
00:53:25,280 --> 00:53:27,479
Mm. You stole my thought.

408
00:53:32,479 --> 00:53:34,280
Sorry.

409
00:53:35,199 --> 00:53:36,999
That's OK.

410
00:53:37,080 --> 00:53:39,080
You can keep it.

411
00:53:40,159 --> 00:53:43,999
It's getting late.
We'd better stay here for the night.

412
00:53:58,440 --> 00:54:00,880
I can't sleep.

413
00:54:00,959 --> 00:54:03,479
Me neither.

414
00:54:03,559 --> 00:54:05,840
Doesn't feel safe, does it?

415
00:54:05,919 --> 00:54:07,920
Outside like this.

416
00:54:08,760 --> 00:54:11,080
I think we're safe enough.

417
00:54:11,159 --> 00:54:13,719
Selena didn't seem to have any trouble.

418
00:54:14,399 --> 00:54:16,800
Yeah, I noticed that.

419
00:54:16,879 --> 00:54:18,320
Hey, Selena...

420
00:54:18,399 --> 00:54:20,400
What? What is it?

421
00:54:21,679 --> 00:54:23,639
How'd you get to sleep?

422
00:54:29,840 --> 00:54:33,560
Bloody hell. Must've needed
a hell of a prescription for that lot.

423
00:54:33,639 --> 00:54:37,759
I didn't need a prescription.
I qualified as a chemist.

424
00:54:37,840 --> 00:54:40,280
Oh, great. Valium.

425
00:54:40,359 --> 00:54:42,839
Not only will we be able to get to sleep

426
00:54:42,919 --> 00:54:46,480
but if we're attacked in the middle
of the night, we won't even care.

427
00:54:46,560 --> 00:54:48,719
- Two each.
- Not for me, thanks.

428
00:54:48,800 --> 00:54:50,759
Can I, Dad?

429
00:54:50,840 --> 00:54:52,760
I don't think so, sweetheart.

430
00:54:52,839 --> 00:54:54,280
Please?

431
00:54:55,719 --> 00:54:57,720
- No.
- I can't sleep.

432
00:55:00,680 --> 00:55:03,279
Come on, Frank. Let her live a little.

433
00:55:04,319 --> 00:55:08,159
- Give her half of one.
- All right. We're on.

434
00:55:18,400 --> 00:55:20,279
Night-night.

435
00:55:21,040 --> 00:55:23,559
You're a big softie, Frank.

436
00:55:52,919 --> 00:55:54,799
Frank?

437
00:55:54,880 --> 00:55:56,879
Hannah?

438
00:55:56,960 --> 00:55:58,760
Frank?

439
00:56:04,159 --> 00:56:06,160
Hello? Hello!

440
00:56:07,159 --> 00:56:08,360
Hello!

441
00:56:08,440 --> 00:56:10,839
Hello! Hello!

442
00:56:18,600 --> 00:56:20,599
Shh...

443
00:56:21,920 --> 00:56:24,599
You're having a bad dream, that's all.

444
00:56:27,240 --> 00:56:29,239
Thanks, Dad.

445
00:57:03,080 --> 00:57:05,560
Come on, sleepyhead.

446
00:57:09,080 --> 00:57:11,079
Come on, Babe Ruth.

447
00:57:14,160 --> 00:57:15,960
Hurry up.

448
00:57:17,639 --> 00:57:21,000
- Did I miss breakfast?
- You'll sleep through anything.

449
00:57:21,079 --> 00:57:25,879
- Did you have a fry-up?
- We'll stop at a pub on the way. Door!

450
00:57:49,440 --> 00:57:53,759
Our location
is the 42nd blockade, the M602,

451
00:57:53,840 --> 00:57:56,800
27 miles northeast of Manchester.

452
00:57:56,879 --> 00:57:58,720
You must find us. Please!

453
00:57:58,799 --> 00:58:00,840
Salvation is here.

454
00:58:00,920 --> 00:58:03,840
The answer to Infection is here.

455
00:58:34,560 --> 00:58:36,559
Must be Manchester.

456
00:58:38,680 --> 00:58:41,919
The whole of Manchester, the whole city.

457
00:58:43,679 --> 00:58:45,920
No fire crews to put it out.

458
00:59:38,480 --> 00:59:40,960
42nd blockade.

459
00:59:41,040 --> 00:59:43,280
This is it.

460
01:00:51,519 --> 01:00:55,359
I don't understand, Dad.
Did they leave?

461
01:00:55,440 --> 01:00:58,440
- I don't like this. I think we should go.
- No!

462
01:01:05,000 --> 01:01:09,639
Vehicles. We should check the vehicles.
There has to be something.

463
01:01:27,039 --> 01:01:28,880
Nothing.

464
01:01:28,959 --> 01:01:30,800
I can't believe it.

465
01:01:30,879 --> 01:01:32,760
Frank...

466
01:01:33,199 --> 01:01:34,999
Frank!

467
01:01:37,120 --> 01:01:38,719
- We have to go.
- Yeah.

468
01:01:38,799 --> 01:01:41,200
Go fucking where?!

469
01:02:18,719 --> 01:02:20,799
Get out of it.

470
01:02:24,160 --> 01:02:26,159
Get out of it!

471
01:02:43,240 --> 01:02:45,720
Dad, are you all right?

472
01:02:45,800 --> 01:02:48,359
Yeah, I'm fine, sweetheart.

473
01:02:49,240 --> 01:02:51,840
Sorry I lost my temper.

474
01:02:51,919 --> 01:02:53,960
Hannah...

475
01:02:54,040 --> 01:02:56,879
I love you very much.

476
01:02:56,960 --> 01:02:58,880
- What?
- Keep away from me.

477
01:02:58,959 --> 01:03:01,200
Stay where you are.

478
01:03:01,279 --> 01:03:04,080
- Dad?
- Keep away from me! Keep away from me!

479
01:03:04,159 --> 01:03:06,560
Keep away! Keep away! Keep away!

480
01:03:06,639 --> 01:03:09,639
- Dad!
- Keep away! Keep away!

481
01:03:11,080 --> 01:03:13,719
What's wrong? Dad!

482
01:03:17,839 --> 01:03:20,159
Jim! Jim, he's infected!

483
01:03:20,240 --> 01:03:22,760
- No!
- Now, Jim! Now!

484
01:03:22,840 --> 01:03:26,119
- Jim, kill him! Jim!
- Dad!

485
01:03:26,199 --> 01:03:27,439
Kill him!

486
01:03:35,559 --> 01:03:37,759
Stay away from him!

487
01:03:38,959 --> 01:03:41,280
Keep away from the body!

488
01:03:43,919 --> 01:03:45,719
Dad?

489
01:04:07,200 --> 01:04:09,760
Three survivors. One male, two female.

490
01:04:09,839 --> 01:04:13,040
I repeat, one male, two female.

491
01:04:13,119 --> 01:04:15,599
ETA, 15.

492
01:04:15,680 --> 01:04:18,040
Put the kettle on.

493
01:05:04,039 --> 01:05:06,440
I'm Major Henry West.

494
01:05:07,640 --> 01:05:09,280
- Welcome.
- Jim.

495
01:05:09,359 --> 01:05:11,279
Hello, Jim.

496
01:05:11,360 --> 01:05:13,040
Hello.

497
01:05:15,200 --> 01:05:19,880
Well, we've got beds with clean sheets
and a boiler that produces hot water.

498
01:05:19,959 --> 01:05:22,279
So you can all have a shower.

499
01:05:22,360 --> 01:05:25,559
You look like you need one. Please.

500
01:05:44,680 --> 01:05:49,679
It ain't funny. I got loads of cooking to do,
you fucking Doris!

501
01:05:50,720 --> 01:05:52,760
Run him over!

502
01:05:55,360 --> 01:05:58,039
How is she doing?

503
01:05:58,120 --> 01:06:01,160
She's lost her dad, Jim. That's how she is.

504
01:06:03,719 --> 01:06:06,120
It's all fucked.

505
01:06:06,200 --> 01:06:08,120
What do you mean?

506
01:06:12,960 --> 01:06:16,400
Oh, don't do that.
Come on, come on, come on.

507
01:06:16,480 --> 01:06:18,479
Hey, don't do that.

508
01:06:20,080 --> 01:06:24,880
Hannah is what Frank says she is. Tough,
strong, and she'll cope just like I'll cope.

509
01:06:24,959 --> 01:06:28,720
- Just like you'll cope.
- I don't want her to have to fucking cope.

510
01:06:29,960 --> 01:06:32,280
I want her to be OK.

511
01:06:33,800 --> 01:06:35,880
When Hannah had her dad it was OK.

512
01:06:35,960 --> 01:06:38,639
It was OK for them and it was OK for us.

513
01:06:41,839 --> 01:06:44,159
Now it's all just fucked.

514
01:07:14,319 --> 01:07:17,039
So you heard our broadcast?

515
01:07:17,120 --> 01:07:20,479
- Yeah, we did.
- We must be a disappointment.

516
01:07:20,560 --> 01:07:26,440
You were hoping for a full brigade. An army
base with helicopters and a field hospital.

517
01:07:28,759 --> 01:07:32,760
- We were just hoping for...
- The answer to Infection.

518
01:07:35,000 --> 01:07:37,000
Yeah.

519
01:07:37,079 --> 01:07:41,400
As I said before, it's here. Though
it may not be quite what you imagined.

520
01:07:41,759 --> 01:07:44,560
- Just feel lucky to have found you.
- You were lucky.

521
01:07:44,639 --> 01:07:47,639
The fire drove hundreds of Infected
out of Manchester.

522
01:07:47,720 --> 01:07:50,679
The surrounding area's teeming with them.

523

01:34:30,160 --> 01:34:32,159
Shh.

Hannah?

I haven't got any fucking bullets!

somewhere. Just you and me.

01:39:01,520 --> 01:39:03,599
- It's a long story.
-
